title: PyTorch+Windows: is parallelization over multiple GPUs possible?
body_html:
I have 2 GPUs, but can't run a simple parallelization official demo of PyTorch. I am using Python 3.6.1, PyTorch 0.2.1+a4fc05a, Windows 7 64 bit, anaconda 4.3.30.

I get the following error:

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\cuda\nccl.py in
_libnccl()
     13     global lib
     14     if lib is None:
---> 15         lib = ctypes.pydll.LoadLibrary(None)
     16         if hasattr(lib, 'ncclCommDestroy'):
     17             lib.ncclCommDestroy.restype = None

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\ctypes\__init__.py in LoadLibrary(self, name)
    424 
    425     def LoadLibrary(self, name):
--> 426         return self._dlltype(name)
    427 
    428 cdll = LibraryLoader(CDLL)

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\ctypes\__init__.py in __init__(self, name, mode, handle, use_errno, use_last_error)
    346 
    347         if handle is None:
--> 348             self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode)
    349         else:
    350             self._handle = handle

TypeError: bad argument type for built-in operation

Here is an extended statement of the question with the source code.
body_text:
I have 2 GPUs, but can't run a simple parallelization official demo of PyTorch. I am using Python 3.6.1, PyTorch 0.2.1+a4fc05a, Windows 7 64 bit, anaconda 4.3.30.
I get the following error:
C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\cuda\nccl.py in
_libnccl()
     13     global lib
     14     if lib is None:
---> 15         lib = ctypes.pydll.LoadLibrary(None)
     16         if hasattr(lib, 'ncclCommDestroy'):
     17             lib.ncclCommDestroy.restype = None

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\ctypes\__init__.py in LoadLibrary(self, name)
    424 
    425     def LoadLibrary(self, name):
--> 426         return self._dlltype(name)
    427 
    428 cdll = LibraryLoader(CDLL)

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\ctypes\__init__.py in __init__(self, name, mode, handle, use_errno, use_last_error)
    346 
    347         if handle is None:
--> 348             self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode)
    349         else:
    350             self._handle = handle

TypeError: bad argument type for built-in operation


Here is an extended statement of the question with the source code.
body:
I have 2 GPUs, but can't run [a simple parallelization official demo of PyTorch](http://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/former_torchies/parallelism_tutorial.html). I am using Python 3.6.1, PyTorch 0.2.1+a4fc05a, Windows 7 64 bit, anaconda 4.3.30.

I get the following error:

```
C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\cuda\nccl.py in
_libnccl()
     13     global lib
     14     if lib is None:
---> 15         lib = ctypes.pydll.LoadLibrary(None)
     16         if hasattr(lib, 'ncclCommDestroy'):
     17             lib.ncclCommDestroy.restype = None

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\ctypes\__init__.py in LoadLibrary(self, name)
    424 
    425     def LoadLibrary(self, name):
--> 426         return self._dlltype(name)
    427 
    428 cdll = LibraryLoader(CDLL)

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\ctypes\__init__.py in __init__(self, name, mode, handle, use_errno, use_last_error)
    346 
    347         if handle is None:
--> 348             self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode)
    349         else:
    350             self._handle = handle

TypeError: bad argument type for built-in operation

```

Here is [an extended statement of the question with the source code.](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48012816/pytorchwindows-is-parallelization-over-multiple-gpus-possible)
